results.title: Brides of Christ (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Sue Masters and Ken Cameron
results.brief_description: A six hour mini-series based on the lives of Sr. Catherine and Sr. Paul who enter the convent in the early 50’s. Behind high convent walls, their lives are circumscribed by centuries old traditions, rites and disciplines, yet they must become part of a changing world. For many, their faith will be sufficient to carry them through their personal crisis. In their care are spirited teenagers, schooled in the old creed, yet eager to taste the new freedoms. Starring Brenda Fricker, Sandy Gore, Josephine Byrnes, Lisa Hensley, Naomi Watts and Kym Wilson.

results.title: Bride of Chucky
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Grace Gilroy, David Kirschner and Ronny Yu
results.brief_description: This is the fourth, and without a doubt the best in the controversial ‘Child’s play’ series. In the latest instalment Chucky (voiced supplied by Brad Dourif), the benevolent child’s toy is bought back to life in this inventive and witty sequel which plays more like a demented homage to ‘Bride of Frankenstein’. The sinister looking doll which is possessed by the evil spirit of a serial killer is resurrected from the dead by his unbalanced goth girlfriend (played with relish by Jennifer Tilly), who has wedding bells on her mind. However Chucky has more sinister intentions than marriage, when he and his trailer trash bride stow away with two runaway teens wrongly accused of murder. Hong Kong director Ronny Yu (‘Bride with the white hair’), and writer Don Mancini have fashioned a wonderfully irresponsible film which proudly wears it’s horror film references on its sleeve, giving the series some surreal, clever twists and turns. Cast also includes John Ritter, Alexis Arquette and Katherine Heigl.

results.title: Bride and groom
results.brief_description: An experiment in animation technique produced by a group of amateur film makers, about a newly wed couple who cannot get rid of a door-to-door salesman. Pixillated technique is used in which the principles of animation are applied to real people rather than inanimate materials such as drawings and three-dimensional puppets.

results.title: Bricklaying : it's easier than you think
results.brief_description: This video is designed to teach the inexperienced handy person to completely undertake the building of simple brick structures. It emphasises the importance of using the correct tools and materials and demonstrates the methods and techniques employed by bricklayers to achieve good results for basic brick constructions.

results.title: Brett Whiteley: Alchemy
results.brief_description: A study of the work, philosophy and artistic process of renowned Australian painter, Brett Whiteley, as he prepares for and then exhibits the extensive panel work, “Alchemy”. The program is also integrated with a discussion of the history and mythology of alchemy in the ancient world and of the practices and beliefs of alchemists which weaves, in an explanatory and complementary way, through the coverage of Whiteley as he paints and discusses his work. Whiteley’s sense of producing different languages in painting, of shifting away from Australian naturalism to seek a balance between the natural and the surreal, is evoked insightfully in the program through the extensive interviews and commentary from Whiteley himself, the view of the artist at work in his studio, and through the thread of the study of alchemy. Along with Whiteley’s comments on his personal philosophies, the focus of the discussion delves into his fascinations and experiences, expressed through the form of his paintings, in terms of the alchemist notion of transmutation, and the ideal of a journey towards bursting through the boundary to dreams. This is exemplified in the work “Alchemy”, where the mind on its meanders, an order lost in detail and an eye to the spiritual is presented in the form of a paneled mural. The program contains footage of the opening of the exhibition of this work with its reception analysed through interviews and sound bytes of Whiteley’s colleagues, friends and family, art critics and curators, providing a close to this meditative outline of Brett Whiteley’s artistic process from original concept to exhibition.

results.title: Brett and friends stick to a job: Brett and Greg
results.brief_description: This tape contains two programs entitled “Brett and Friends - Why stick to a job?” and “Brett and Greg - what are the options?” Brett and friends sets the context for Brett and Greg and should be viewed first. The two programs represent the viewpoints of Brett and Greg and their friends, some of whom had been unemployed for several months at the time of taping

results.title: Breeding for quality
results.creator_credit: Western Australian Government Film Unit and Norman A. Uren
results.brief_description: England, Denmark, New Zealand and America are the major dairying countries of the world which use artificial insemination. In order to improve the dairy herds in Western Australia the government has set up a research station which supplies commercial herds with semen from top-quality bulls. Records show that artificial insemination has proved its worth to the dairy farmer in increased production, better quality milk and healthier herds.

results.title: Breath of life
results.brief_description: If breathing stops, the brain can only live three to five minutes. The film shows the importance and technique of mouth-to-mouth resuscitation. It includes the use of examples of emergency situations where this knowledge is applicable. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.
